intro: Ludwigia stenorraphe subsp. macrosepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of streams. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for aquatic and bog gardens.
